docs.title: Welcome to scrapy-folder-tree's documentation!
docs.text:
Are you using scrapy to download files, and you want to organize the downloaded files into different folders using a folder structure? This Scrapy pipeline is what you are looking for.

This is a scrapy pipeline that provides an easy way to store files and images using various folder structures.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: You are here to help on dropboxignore? Awesome, feel welcome and read the following sections in order to know how to ask questions and how to work on something. There are many ways to contribute, from writing tutorials or blog posts, improving the documentation, adding extra test-cases, submitting bug reports and feature requests or writing code.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
For something that is bigger than a one or two line fix:

  1. Fork the repo
  2. Commit the changes
  3. If you like the change and think the project could use it:
    • Be sure you have followed the code style for the project.
    • Update documentation accordingly
    • Add test cases if is applicable.

docs.title: How to report a bug
docs.text: Go to the issue tracker and create a new issue and follow the template.

docs.title: Dev Environment
docs.text:
Navigate in the project's root folder and run:

poetry install --dev

Make sure that poetry and pre-commit is already installed.

docs.title: Static analysis
docs.text:
The project is static analysed using the following tools:

  • isort
  • mypy
  • black

as pre-commit hooks:

pre-commit run --all-files

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Use the following settings in your project:

ITEM_PIPELINES = {
    'scrapy_folder_tree.FilesHashTreePipeline': 300
}

docs.title: File name
docs.text:
This group of pipelines uses a folder structure based on crawling date.

  • scrapy_folder_tree.FilesDateTreePipeline
  • scrapy_folder_tree.ImagesDateTreePipeline

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
A file called fh1udj1.png and crawled at 2022-01-02, will be stored using the following folder structure:

2022
└── 01
    └── 02
        └── fh1udj1.png

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
You can configure the following in the Scrapy project settings:

  • FOLDER_TREE_DEPTH (default: 3): Specify the folder depth.
  • FOLDER_TREE_LENGTH (default: 1): Specify the folder length.

docs.title: File name
docs.text:
This group of pipelines uses a folder structure based on crawling date.

  • scrapy_folder_tree.FilesTimeTreePipeline
  • scrapy_folder_tree.ImagesTimeTreePipeline

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
A file called fh1udj1.png and crawled at 13:52:20, will be stored using the following folder structure:

13
└── 52
    └── 20
        └── fh1udj1.png

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
You can configure the following in the Scrapy project settings:

  • FOLDER_TREE_TIME_FORMAT (default: %H/%M/%S): Specify a custom date format.

docs.title: File name
docs.text:
This group of pipelines uses a folder structure based on the file's name.

  • scrapy_folder_tree.FilesHashTreePipeline
  • scrapy_folder_tree.ImagesHashTreePipeline

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
fh1udj1.png file will be stored using the following folder structure:

f
└── h
    └── 1
        └── fh1udj1.png

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
You can configure the following in the Scrapy project settings:

  • FOLDER_TREE_DEPTH (default: 3): Specify the folder depth.
  • FOLDER_TREE_LENGTH (default: 1): Specify the folder length.
